page.title: 08ARABLE FARMING
page.content: ARABLE FARMING By far the largest usage of land in the Stanton area of Shroposhire is farming and in our particular area of study, it splits fairly evenly three ways between livestock, arable crops and forestry. There was quite a diversity of of crops grown, and the fields are generally not large by modern standards. Oats and barley were all in evidence, not as ripe as one would have expected due we are sure to the poor weather this year so far. The other crops we saw were peas potatoes and oil seed rape. It appears that the peas are sold direct for processing, the maincrop potatoes are transported to the wholesale market at Wolverhampton or Birmingham. Oil seed rape is grown for two reasons, as a cattle feed and to nitrogenise the soil.
